issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: The product is working as designed.
resolution.name: Not a Bug

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
Clean install of Eucalyptus 3.3, in Managed mode can successfully launch instances, but network traffic is pretty much un-useable regarding the instance.  I can ssh into the instance from the frontend (and that takes 20 seconds to access the instance).

{code}
$ date; ssh -i admin-creds/admin.priv root@192.168.55.201 "uname -a"; date
Sun May 19 16:50:11 PDT 2013
Linux ip-172-25-118-211 2.6.18-308.11.1.el5 #1 SMP Tue Jul 10 08:48:43 EDT 2012 x86_64 x86_64 x86_64 GNU/Linux
Sun May 19 16:50:31 PDT 2013
{code}

From within the instance, I can ping the CC with no problem (the gateway for the instance and the public IP of the CC):

{code}
-bash-3.2# ping 172.25.118.193
PING 172.25.118.193 (172.25.118.193) 56(84) bytes of data.
64 bytes from 172.25.118.193: icmp_seq=1 ttl=64 time=0.358 ms
64 bytes from 172.25.118.193: icmp_seq=2 ttl=64 time=0.359 ms

--- 172.25.118.193 ping statistics ---
2 packets transmitted, 2 received, 0% packet loss, time 1000ms
rtt min/avg/max/mdev = 0.358/0.358/0.359/0.018 ms
-bash-3.2# ping 10.104.1.139
PING 10.104.1.139 (10.104.1.139) 56(84) bytes of data.
64 bytes from 10.104.1.139: icmp_seq=1 ttl=64 time=0.309 ms
64 bytes from 10.104.1.139: icmp_seq=2 ttl=64 time=0.326 ms

--- 10.104.1.139 ping statistics ---
2 packets transmitted, 2 received, 0% packet loss, time 1000ms
rtt min/avg/max/mdev = 0.309/0.317/0.326/0.019 ms
{code}

However, I can't ping google.com from the instance:

{code}
-bash-3.2# ping google.com 10
ping: unknown host google.com
{code}

I can ping google.com from the CC though:

{code}
$ ping google.com
PING google.com (74.125.224.201) 56(84) bytes of data.
64 bytes from lax02s02-in-f9.1e100.net (74.125.224.201): icmp_seq=1 ttl=54 time=6.24 ms
64 bytes from lax02s02-in-f9.1e100.net (74.125.224.201): icmp_seq=2 ttl=54 time=6.28 ms
64 bytes from lax02s02-in-f9.1e100.net (74.125.224.201): icmp_seq=3 ttl=54 time=6.26 ms
^C
--- google.com ping statistics ---
3 packets transmitted, 3 received, 0% packet loss, time 2208ms
rtt min/avg/max/mdev = 6.246/6.264/6.286/0.066 ms
{code}

resolv.conf on the CC looks like the following:

{code}
$ cat /etc/resolv.conf
; generated by /sbin/dhclient-script
search prc.eucalyptus-systems.com
nameserver 10.1.1.254
nameserver 8.8.4.4
{code}

resolv.conf looks like the following on the instance:

{code}
# cat /etc/resolv.conf
; generated by /sbin/dhclient-script
search eucalyptus
nameserver 10.1.1.254
nameserver 10.104.1.139
{code}

Eucalyptus DNS service is not enabled on this cloud.  To test to see if lookups could happen from the instance, ran the following test against the DNS server on 10.1.1.254:

{code}
-bash-3.2# nslookup 192.168.7.1 10.1.1.254
;; connection timed out; trying next origin
;; connection timed out; no servers could be reached
{code}

Metadata service lookup did work:

{code}
# curl http://169.254.169.254/latest/meta-data
ami-id
ami-launch-index
ami-manifest-path
block-device-mapping/
hostname
instance-id
instance-type
kernel-id
local-hostname
local-ipv4
placement/
public-hostname
public-ipv4
public-keys/
ramdisk-id
reservation-id
security-groups
{code}

If anyone wants to have access to this machine, please let me know.
fields.summary: Instance traffic is very slow to instance; can ssh into instance but can't ping anything other than CC
fields.environment:
*non-HA*

* 1 X Frontend (CLC, Walrus, SC, CC)
** pub interface - em1 - 10.104.1.139
** priv interface - em2 - 10.101.40.139
* 1 x NC
** pub interface - em2 - 10.101.40.138

Managed mode (frontend is gateway for physical NC)

Systems information for both machines is the same:

{code}
$ uname -a
Linux g-15-03.prc.eucalyptus-systems.com 2.6.32-358.6.2.el6.x86_64 #1 SMP Thu May 16 20:59:36 UTC 2013 x86_64 x86_64 x86_64 GNU/Linux

$ cat /etc/*release
CentOS release 6.4 (Final)
{code}

comments.body:
eucalyptus.conf network section from Frontend:

{code}
VNET_DNS="10.1.1.254"
VNET_LOCALIP="10.104.1.139"
VNET_MODE="MANAGED"
VNET_NETMASK="255.255.0.0"
VNET_PRIVINTERFACE="em2"
VNET_PUBINTERFACE="em1"
VNET_PUBLICIPS="192.168.55.201-192.168.55.210"
VNET_SUBNET="172.25.0.0"
{code}

eucalyptus.conf network section from NC:

{code}
USE_VIRTIO_DISK="1"
USE_VIRTIO_NET="1"
USE_VIRTIO_ROOT="1"
VNET_ADDRSPERNET="32"
VNET_DNS="10.1.1.254"
VNET_LOCALIP="10.104.1.139"
VNET_MODE="MANAGED"
VNET_NETMASK="255.255.0.0"
VNET_PUBINTERFACE="em2"
VNET_PUBLICIPS="192.168.55.201-192.168.55.210"
VNET_SUBNET="172.25.0.0"
{code}

Output from euca2ools commands:

{code}
$ euca-describe-instances
RESERVATION	r-DC3C4062	930736385110	default
INSTANCE	i-87733FB8	emi-E6C438FB	192.168.55.201	172.25.118.211	running	admin	0		m1.xlarge	2013-05-19T23:28:30.085Z	ghostface-killah	eki-901A3235	eri-7AA135B0		monitoring-disabled	192.168.55.201	172.25.118.211			instance-store
TAG	instance	i-87733FB8	euca:node	10.101.40.138
$ euca-describe-group
GROUP	sg-FAB64264	930736385110	default	default group
PERMISSION	930736385110	default	ALLOWS	tcp	22	22	FROM	CIDR	0.0.0.0/0	ingress
PERMISSION	930736385110	default	ALLOWS	icmp	-1	-1	FROM	CIDR	0.0.0.0/0	ingress
{code}

_*NOTE*:  As in past versions of Eucalyptus, I stopped iptables and made sure the service didn't start on reboot by changing its status to off via chkconfig on both Frontend and NC.  I also noticed that if I didn't do this on the NC, that the NC wouldn't show up as a resource when I did euca-describe-availability-zones verbose._
